Guillaume,

Have you tried changing the loglevel in the equilibrate command=
? If loglevel is > 0, an 
html file will be written with debug information.=
 If loglevel > 2, you can see the initial 
guess, which is where I was seei=
ng trouble.

Josh

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Guillaume" <guillaume.d=
aill@...> wrote:
>
> Hi everybody
> 
> I'm trying to consider in the same t=
ime the formation of graphite and
> liquid water during the combustion of m=
ethane.
> The error is about water. I have modified the python example
> "a=
diabatic.py" and add the water's phase.
> 
> my script (python):
> 
> 
> fr=
om Cantera import*
> Temp=3D300
> press=3D1*OneAtm
> Va=3D2
> n=3D0.1
> Vr=
=3Dn*Va
> 
> phase=3DIdealGasMix('gri30.xml','gri30')
> carbon =3D importPh=
ase('graphite.xml','graphite')
> water =3D importPhase('water.xml','liquid_=
water')
> 
> mix_phases =3D [ (phase, 1.0), (carbon, 0.0), (water,0.0)]
> n=
sp=3Dphase.nSpecies()
> 
> iCH4=3Dphase.speciesIndex('CH4')
> iO2=3Dphase.s=
peciesIndex('O2')
> 
> x=3Dzeros(nsp,'d')
> x[iCH4]=3D1
> x[iO2]=3DVr
> 
> =
phase.set(T=3D Temp, P =3D press, X=3Dx)
> mix=3DMixture(mix_phases)
> mix.=
setTemperature(Temp)
> mix.setPressure(press)
> 
> 
> mix.equilibrate("HP",=
 err =3D 1.0e-3, maxsteps =3D 20000, maxiter =3D 5000,
> loglevel =3D 0)
> =
print mix
> 
> 
> And the error :
> ***************************************=
*********
>                 Cantera Error!                  
> ************=
************************************
> 
> 
> Procedure: MultiPhaseEquil
> E=
rror:   condensed-phase speciesH2O(L) is excluded since its thermo
> proper=
ties are 
> not valid at this temperature, but it has non-zero moles in the=

> initial state.
> 
> 
> 
> If i change the initial temperature 300 to 100=
0, there is no error.
> If i change the "HP" option to "TP", there is no er=
ror (even if the
> initial temperature if 1000 K).
>
